reviews.text:
It's my favorite pizza place.
10 out of 10 pizza.. always clean and the service is amazing.
You should go try it.
I can't say enough good stuff about this place.

Good pizza, sometimes quick service. It‚Äôs not really ever busy, and I feel like they don‚Äôt have great branding or presence and they add a lot of unnecessary things like breakfasts and deserts without perfecting the pizza part of it. We always get margherita pizza and the knots are actually really good but we decided to try the veggie pizza and it‚Äôs sort of disappointing seeing they use canned mushrooms instead of fresh ingredients. We hope they stay in business but I feel like they could make small adjustments to make it that much better üëçüèª
We have ordered pizza from them before and it was great. This time they didn't put any sauce on it, burnt the bottom and it was like eating a flavorless piece of burnt bread. Disappointed!

New York pizza is my favorite kind of pizza! I tried this place for the first time and it was delicious! You walk in and it‚Äôs very inviting and they display all of their pizzas they have. You can order pizza by the slice or order whole pizzas. I ordered a whole pepperoni pizza to go. I am so glad there is a good New York pizza place so close to where I live! I will definitely be back!

We got a whole ‚ÄúMargherita‚Äù pizza it was delicious!! ‚ÄúA Slice of NY‚Äù it‚Äôs a great place!!. Perfect crust and a great sauce/cheese/dough ratio.

If you‚Äôre nearby and craving good pizza - this is your spot!

recentReviews.text: Garlic knots were really hard and burned. I was looking forward to trying this place but don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll go back.
Pizza is great. Garlic knots were stale though and burnt‚òπÔ∏è
We have ordered pizza from them before and it was great. This time they didn't put any sauce on it, burnt the bottom and it was like eating a flavorless piece of burnt bread. Disappointed!
The Pizza is amazing, different from almost everywhere I've had around here, so good. I can't stop thinking about it.

It‚Äôs pizza, and it‚Äôs thin like a ny slice. But I found the sauce way too sweet. The crust was fine. Good hold with no flop. But the sauce ruined it.

Service was mid, slices took a little long. But I assume 2 slices, max 5 mins not 10. Everyone seemed bored. But that might just be the area or city service workers. At 7.25 min wage, I might be the same

Atmosphere was fine, lunch time, so it had some foot traffic. But some music would help
Good ny style pizza. Tiny spicy pepperoni's. Great little gem in springville if you're craving pizza and don't want the large pizza chain bland pizza
We had the lunch special. The pizza and service were very good. Enjoyed the authentic thin crust.
Got a pep pizza here last week and it was really good. Best pizza in Springville for sure!

What a great treat when we moved to Springville.  The cheese pizza is every bit as good as Chicago or NYC.  Ask for a slight drizzle of olive oil before they heat it up.  And the sauce has a great flavor. I drop in for quick bite regularly.  Most of business is take out so the pizzarea is not crazy.  Family friendly.
This is the worst grandma pie I've ever had. Super thick and dense just a light sprinkle of cheese so bad. I've had grandma pie all over NYC & Jersey this should be removed from the menu.

detailedReviews.author: Hanna Nez
detailedReviews.text: Garlic knots were really hard and burned. I was looking forward to trying this place but don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll go back.

detailedReviews.author: Deshavoo M
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is great. Garlic knots were stale though and burnt‚òπÔ∏è

detailedReviews.author: Taylor Safford
detailedReviews.text: We have ordered pizza from them before and it was great. This time they didn't put any sauce on it, burnt the bottom and it was like eating a flavorless piece of burnt bread. Disappointed!

detailedReviews.author: Mark Simons
detailedReviews.text: The Pizza is amazing, different from almost everywhere I've had around here, so good. I can't stop thinking about it.

detailedReviews.author: Yorq Ligma
detailedReviews.text:
It‚Äôs pizza, and it‚Äôs thin like a ny slice. But I found the sauce way too sweet. The crust was fine. Good hold with no flop. But the sauce ruined it.

Service was mid, slices took a little long. But I assume 2 slices, max 5 mins not 10. Everyone seemed bored. But that might just be the area or city service workers. At 7.25 min wage, I might be the same

Atmosphere was fine, lunch time, so it had some foot traffic. But some music would help

detailedReviews.author: Bryan M
detailedReviews.text: Good ny style pizza. Tiny spicy pepperoni's. Great little gem in springville if you're craving pizza and don't want the large pizza chain bland pizza

detailedReviews.author: Brian Florang
detailedReviews.text: We had the lunch special. The pizza and service were very good. Enjoyed the authentic thin crust.

detailedReviews.author: Easy S
detailedReviews.text: Got a pep pizza here last week and it was really good. Best pizza in Springville for sure!

detailedReviews.author: karen johnson
detailedReviews.text: What a great treat when we moved to Springville.  The cheese pizza is every bit as good as Chicago or NYC.  Ask for a slight drizzle of olive oil before they heat it up.  And the sauce has a great flavor. I drop in for quick bite regularly.  Most of business is take out so the pizzarea is not crazy.  Family friendly.

detailedReviews.author: Andrew Christopher
detailedReviews.text: This is the worst grandma pie I've ever had. Super thick and dense just a light sprinkle of cheese so bad. I've had grandma pie all over NYC & Jersey this should be removed from the menu.

detailedReviews.author: Jason Carrillo
detailedReviews.text: Some of the best pizza I've ever had. Each bite feels like a bit of heaven. Its my first choice when getting pizza

detailedReviews.author: J W
detailedReviews.text: Inconsistency.. I got a slice that was reheated it was really good. Went back reheated slice, not that good. Decided to get a whole pizza to see if it would be what I hoped for. Not that good.

detailedReviews.author: Ray Grover
detailedReviews.text: Good Day! As the future Mayor of Springville I Ray Grover highly recommend A Slice of NY Pizza as the absolute best (sorry Two Jacks!) pizza this side of Selinsgrove, PA! The quality is always constantly top notch as is the prompt service with the perfect Main Street location and an authentic East Coast pizzeria ambiance. The place always has me coming back for more and will you too! If you haven't tried the place yet give them a whirl, you won't regret it!

detailedReviews.author: Liz Thibault
detailedReviews.text: The pizza does remind me of NY style.  I appreciated the sauce, it had the taste of San Marzano tomatoes. The crust was also very good and has a think and floppy consistency. It was not too greasy, but I would have loved it to be just slightly more well-done, or to have been asked if I would like it baked to well-done. Wish the service was me streamlined.  Took the employee quite a while to pause what they were doing in the corner to acknowledge us.

detailedReviews.author: Kasyn Gross
detailedReviews.text: Husband went to boston couple months ago and said this establishments pizza was just like the ones over there. Margherita pizza was amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Joe Leventhal
detailedReviews.text:
It's my favorite pizza place.
10 out of 10 pizza.. always clean and the service is amazing.
You should go try it.
I can't say enough good stuff about this place.

detailedReviews.author: Tom Harker
detailedReviews.text:
Honestly, it was fast food pizza. Nothing going to change your life here, but a fun place to try. The pizza doesn‚Äôt look that appetizing (some better lighting might go a long way), but it tasted great after it was heated up.

The decor sort of tries to be hip on one wall and the seating is good there. The other 90% of the place feels like a converted 7/11 and kind of haphazardly put together as an afterthought.

I‚Äôve been here several times. They changed the lunch special, so the included drink is limited to a much smaller selection of canned drinks, but still a decent deal for a slice, drink, and a couple garlic knots.

detailedReviews.author: aaron mangini
detailedReviews.text: I wanted the traditional crispy crust that is associated with a good NY style pie, but the crust here was floppy and I even asked for them to baked it for a little longer to make sure I got a crispy crust. Which it was not. The young ladies behind the bar were great. The good thing is that a slice of pizza is inexpensive at only 3.50. maybe it was just the slice that I got, but Iight try it again due to the prices

detailedReviews.author: Milo Valentine
detailedReviews.text: used to come here for lunch twice a week maybe more. so good. owner was funny af the one time i saw him. just check his replies to reviews. again so good

detailedReviews.author: Nanette Littlefield
detailedReviews.text:
Just ordered from here for our work through DoorDash.

Chicken Parm Pizza and Garlic Knots were the best I have ever had! Definitely give this place a try!

detailedReviews.author: Bridger Stewart
detailedReviews.text: There‚Äôs not a better pizza in south Utah county. This guy has got it figured out. A true Brooklyn style pizza with a 120 year old recipe that kicks butt. If somebody wants to bring pizza to my store for my employees, I will only allow them to bring A slice of NY!! TRY THE TEXAN!!

detailedReviews.author: Vanessa Espeland
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza and great taste, best pizza I have eaten in a very long time :) Very friendly staff, and the prices are good, the pizzas are huge :)

detailedReviews.author: Carmen Radford
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza by the slice in Utah County

detailedReviews.author: Monica Wood
detailedReviews.text: Their Chicken Parm pizza is honestly incredible. We make special trips to Springville just for that pizza. The sauce is so flavorful- I usually feel the sauce basically blends in, but I realized that I've just been missing out on good sauce my whole life. I could eat the sauce alone and I do. The ricotta is soo good on it, and the dough is super good as well. Also, it has the perfect crunch! Seriously, I've realized while writing this that it's a perfect pizza. Don't miss out on this!

detailedReviews.author: Maria Arias
detailedReviews.text:
We got a whole ‚ÄúMargherita‚Äù pizza it was delicious!! ‚ÄúA Slice of NY‚Äù it‚Äôs a great place!!. Perfect crust and a great sauce/cheese/dough ratio.

If you‚Äôre nearby and craving good pizza - this is your spot!

detailedReviews.author: Ash Li
detailedReviews.text: Good pizza, sometimes quick service. It‚Äôs not really ever busy, and I feel like they don‚Äôt have great branding or presence and they add a lot of unnecessary things like breakfasts and deserts without perfecting the pizza part of it. We always get margherita pizza and the knots are actually really good but we decided to try the veggie pizza and it‚Äôs sort of disappointing seeing they use canned mushrooms instead of fresh ingredients. We hope they stay in business but I feel like they could make small adjustments to make it that much better üëçüèª

detailedReviews.author: Pedro Castro
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is always fresh and delicious love going there to get the lunch special or just a whole pizza

detailedReviews.author: P. Allred
detailedReviews.text:
Came here based on high reviews. I‚Äôve had NY pizza plenty of times, as I lived there for years. Just felt like it was underwhelming.

Based on other reviews, I might try again; I came during evening hours when teens were working, and there might be a quality variance.

detailedReviews.author: Kyrie Chapman
detailedReviews.text: Really just wanted a Slice of pizza on my way home from work. Stopped in, and received fast efficient service. Slices were huge, and tasty! My first visit, and not my last. Would love to stop by and order a whole pizza next time!

detailedReviews.author: nicholies raviolies!
detailedReviews.text: Alex is the best, and good looking

detailedReviews.author: Heather Bridegan
detailedReviews.text: Great Pizza. Definitely will be back. Huge slices just like in NY and flavors are amazing.  Crust is great too. Sauce was a little on the sweet side for me. I prefer more savory but over all great. Employees were very friendly.  Atmosphere..i really liked the wall art. I wish there was more lower tables..im short and its hard to get up on the high stools. But over all great place.

detailedReviews.author: Reagan Park
detailedReviews.text: I love the pestoroni pizza!

detailedReviews.author: Megan Larsen
detailedReviews.text: New York pizza is my favorite kind of pizza! I tried this place for the first time and it was delicious! You walk in and it‚Äôs very inviting and they display all of their pizzas they have. You can order pizza by the slice or order whole pizzas. I ordered a whole pepperoni pizza to go. I am so glad there is a good New York pizza place so close to where I live! I will definitely be back!

detailedReviews.author: Brandon DeHart
detailedReviews.text: Iv been coming here for my lunches lately and iv been loving it!!

detailedReviews.author: Ava Geertsen
detailedReviews.text: Best pizza in Utah county!

detailedReviews.author: Bere Huerta (Me-myself-n-I)
detailedReviews.text: Excelente servicio todos los j√≥venes empleados muy trabajadores y amables el lugar est√° impecablemente limpio y el sabor delicioso vale la pena venir.

detailedReviews.author: Joseph Leventhal
detailedReviews.text: I finally found the best pizza in utah. You have to come try this place. I'm not from around here, and I miss real NY style pizza. This place gets it... my favorite is the peperoni, and a close second is the chicken parm.

detailedReviews.author: Seba Gonzalez
detailedReviews.text: 100% recomendadas, riqu√≠simas la masa y los ingredientes üòã  y una muy buena  atenci√≥n . Seguro volvemos üëåüçÄ

detailedReviews.text:

detailedReviews.author: Owen Walker
detailedReviews.text: Can‚Äôt speak to New York authenticity, but there was quick and friendly service and the food bussed. A little expensive for what it was though (10$ for 2 slices)

detailedReviews.author: Mike Casperson
detailedReviews.text: Pizza is EXCELLENT! Perfect taste of NYC!

detailedReviews.author: Joseph
detailedReviews.text: Everything was good except the knots needed more garlic or marinara or something

detailedReviews.author: Jacob Gunderson
detailedReviews.text: Good slice of pepperoni.

detailedReviews.author: Justin Pinegar
detailedReviews.text:
It‚Äôs either the best or worst pizza in town, depending on who is working. If the adults are there, it‚Äôs been great. When the young teens are working, it ranges from just ok to not edible.

For context, some of the younger workers messed up/burned my last two orders, so they gave me a free pizza to apologize. I thought that was pretty cool until I got home to find that free one was also burned and inexplicably made without sauce. So it was a little aggravating.

detailedReviews.author: Shelley Throckmorton
detailedReviews.text: I love NY Style pizza. The concept here is great. Only problem is that it‚Äôs hit or miss when it comes to getting a good slice of pizza. I‚Äôve had some really good slices there, but then I‚Äôve also experienced picking up a slice to go- only to find that when I got home, it was burnt on the bottom from having been heated in their oven for too long. Be sure to check the bottom before you leave the store.

detailedReviews.author: Spencer P.
detailedReviews.text: Owner is very mean and has no respect, this pizza could be the best in Utah (it‚Äôs not) and I still wouldn‚Äôt come, don‚Äôt come here unless you want to be insulted, don‚Äôt worry I won‚Äôt be coming back as if any one does, hopefully the owner doesn‚Äôt say something stupid in response to prove thisü§∑

detailedReviews.author: javier gamez
detailedReviews.text:
Good pizza  real  New York stile  big. Slices  just lake
in New york

detailedReviews.author: Tari York
detailedReviews.text: I wish I could do 4.5 stars because I really did enjoy the pizza. Taking a whole star off is harsh due to personal preference. I wish the pizza had a little more sauce, though. And I like my pizza a bit greasy. I‚Äôd eat here again for sure.

detailedReviews.author: curtis otterson
detailedReviews.text: Super yummy! Garlic knots are awesome!

detailedReviews.author: Heidi Anderson
detailedReviews.text: We brought home a Grandma Pie, and a half cheese and pepperoni and garlic knots. They were so incredibly delicious! The Grandma Pie had some of the best flavor I've ever had on a pizza! Will definitely return!

detailedReviews.author: Trey Cadiz
detailedReviews.text:
Mmmmmmhmm ü§§

Very nice and friendly staff, wonderful and crispy crust. Mmmmm

detailedReviews.author: Michael A. Hickman
detailedReviews.text: Best Pizza in the State of Utah

detailedReviews.author: Texas Hank Palmer
detailedReviews.text:
Dang good pizza. Price might seem high, but they‚Äôre huge, so you‚Äôre getting a costco-sized slice for like $2.50

EDIT:
Went again this week and there was hardly any cheese on our pizzas and the undercarriage was overcooked and the pizza overall was a little smaller than the last time. Was hoping this would be my go-to but I‚Äôll probably skip the next time.

detailedReviews.author: Noah Duerst
detailedReviews.text: Good pizza, friendly staff, and cute environment

detailedReviews.author: Joseph Andrews
detailedReviews.text: We had the pleasure of meeting the owner who recommended we stop by for a slice. They all sounded so good but I ended up getting the western and the pulled pork. They were so good and I loved the topping combination. The crust was tasty and had that good chew. Can't wait to go back and try the others combinations.

detailedReviews.author: Zackery
detailedReviews.text: We tried the grandma pie a few months ago. It was amazing ‚Ä¶ NOW EVERY TIME ( we‚Äôve ordered 6 times since ) since we ordered it‚Äôs never the same. Is most recent one was chewy and had zero sauce on it.  Bummer that they can‚Äôt seem to train their high school employees to get it right.  We won‚Äôt be eating there anymore.  Too expensive for inconsistent food

detailedReviews.author: Jacob Paulsen
detailedReviews.text: There are many pizzas out and while you could order your own pizza it seems most people just order 1 or more slices of the available options. They put your slice back in the oven for a few minutes. Lunch special was a good deal. Our pizza was pretty good. Not life changing but good.

detailedReviews.author: Jeri Beri
detailedReviews.text: My only complaint is the customer service. I waited and waited and waited never to be greeted, never to be looked at while the cashier stood with her face down probably in her phone. 2 other workers walked right past me and not once did attempt to ask if I needed to order. I eneded up eventually walking out. I wont come back here strictly because of how rude the employees were. Im sorry but customer service these days in the younger generation has become non existent.

detailedReviews.author: luke lamoreaux
detailedReviews.text: pretty good pizza place. affordable but not the greatest in the area. you should still definitely give it a try because it was not bad.

detailedReviews.author: Michelangelo
detailedReviews.text: Great customers service kitchen ladies are so awesome super friendly and the pizza are üòä

detailedReviews.author: Ulises Gutierrez
detailedReviews.text:
This is my favorite Pizza place in Utah County! I try to go at least once a week to get their lunch special. The staff are very friendly and are able to give me their recommendations when I am not sure what to order. I have tried most of their styles and have not been disappointed yet. The restaurant is decorated with black & white murals depicting different areas of New York and are complemented by the swing music that is usually playing on their sound system. Whenever I eat here I feel like I am in an over-the-top caricature of New York and it definitely helps break up the monotony of the work day.

If you make a large order, or order for several people make sure to double check that the order is correct before you leave. On two occasions they have forgotten to put the garlic knots in my lunch special when multiple people are ordering. Despite this I plan on continuing to stop by weekly. Highly recommended!

detailedReviews.author: Kasey Gentry
detailedReviews.text: We just tried this place for the first time tonight. The pizza was delicious and we tried many different ones. The special- chicken parm was divine. And the crust was perfect. I‚Äôm excited for this place. I hope to see some more family style seating and maybe have some music playing? It was eerily quiet. My only critique is that the garlic knots were a little heavy handed on the amount of garlic used. Still yum though! We will definitely be back.

detailedReviews.author: Lorin Lords
detailedReviews.text: Best New York pizza.

detailedReviews.author: Casey P
detailedReviews.text: Literally best pizza, since NY. Love this place!

detailedReviews.author: Jan Francisco
detailedReviews.text: Clean, open atmosphere. Great food, reasonable prices.

detailedReviews.author: Travel with Briana Derry
detailedReviews.text: Great place for a quick bite! Pizza is amazing!

detailedReviews.author: Bryce Bott
detailedReviews.text: The pizza smells and tastes phenomenal! I couldn‚Äôt resist taking a bite from the box on the way home. We are die hards for Two Jacks and struggled to try a new restaurant when Two Jacks is right there. Still love them but this definitely tastes like a quality pizza! I can see how the others are concerned about how the pizza looks on the marble countertop but when it is heated, it literally comes out fresh and it‚Äôs freaking bomb. Will definitely return!!!!

detailedReviews.author: Kelsey Corfield
detailedReviews.text: This pizza is so good! I got the bbq pulled pork and it was to die for!! Go during lunch time - they have a lunch special where you can get 1 slice (and the slices are huge), 2 garlic knots, and a drink for 6$!!

detailedReviews.author: Emily Fairchild Cutler
detailedReviews.text: Really hit the spot. I've got about zero experience with NY pizza but the slice, but hey, it was great pizza and ranch and garlic knots. I'd totally go again, even when I'm a county away. The interior is spacious and clean, a bathroom at the back, lots of standing room, then chairs around, four tables inside and two picnic bench tables outside. Pizzas are readymade and in view so you can browse and choose what you want. I got two meal deals‚Äîeach with a slice, two knots, and a drink‚Äîfor about $12, so that's good spending. You just walk in, order and pay at the counter, then wait for your order and go. I really like the small sliced pepperoni on pizza, so I was glad to see it used here, and it was great. For their big pies they have a nice melty cheese, and for the pie with pecorino (mmm), the cheesiness has a great chew to it to go with the thicker crust on that one. Definitely recommend that one. Drink variety is pretty great! Ranch and red sauce for dipping are great. The red sauce cup is the same sauce they use on their pizza. It's kinda sweet and it's chunky not smooth; I liked it a lot. The worker said they have gluten free options. Signage also showed a breakfast item, and it looked really yummy. Breakfast 6-11. The worker was very nice, very professional and changed gloves between services rendered, gave me an extra slice when the first one stuck to the oven and came out torn, so it was just a great first experience for sure, and I'd absolutely recommend giving it a try and give their business your patronage! Leftovers reheated really well with that hot pan and ice cube hack (lookit up), so buying a whole pie (they seemed super well priced for their size) won't go to waste if any lasts for leftovers! Parking lot is relatively small, but spacious so getting in and out isn't a problem. Yep, give it a go!

detailedReviews.author: Spencer Clingo
detailedReviews.text: This place sells amazing, authentic, New York style pizza. We've been here twice now and it was so worth the price and the drive. The pizza is pre-cooked, but they heat it up again in an actual oven so it tastes just right.

detailedReviews.author: Josh Newman
detailedReviews.text: As a New Yorker, my expectations were quite high and unfortunately, I was disappointed. The ingredients didn't taste fresh to me and the atmosphere was underwhelming. I'd love to see a more authentic buffalo slice. Employees are nice though and perhaps a pie that's made to order is better than the individual slices I had.

detailedReviews.author: Branch Hunsaker
detailedReviews.text: Always love Slice of NY. It's tradition that I get a slice with my kids every Saturday.

detailedReviews.author: Jesus Baldemar Lievano
detailedReviews.text: Great place, these pizzas are awesome!!!

detailedReviews.author: Travis Williams
detailedReviews.text:
AMAZING pizza. Locally owned, family run business.
If you are looking for a slice, or a full pie, this is the place to go.
Best slice along the entire wasatch front. Cant wait to go back

detailedReviews.author: Adrian Ford
detailedReviews.text: It was just ok pizza

detailedReviews.author: Kayne Phillips
detailedReviews.text: Pretty good pizza, good selection of pizza to get a slice from, quick. Nice spot for lunch.

detailedReviews.author: Troy
detailedReviews.text:
Owner should spend more time improving their food versus criticizing reviewers.   Good luck with your establishment.  I truly wish you the best.

I really want this place to succeed and do well.  I bought slices here on two different occasions about a week apart.  Both times slices had too much flour on the bottom but were cooked well otherwise.

Pizza did not have a lot of flavor however which is my main concern.  Sauce needed more punch.

IMO Nico's(Provo) and Lucys(Orem) reign supreme if you are a NY style pizza lover, both comparably priced as well.

This is not NY style pizza that I am accustomed to living in NY and NJ.  It is too doughy and too much flour on the undercarriage.

detailedReviews.author: Beverly Johnson, REALTOR
detailedReviews.text: Great pizza, super nice owner, first time visit and will definitely be back next time I'm in town!

detailedReviews.author: Shayna Johnson
detailedReviews.text: Stopped in for lunch and it was great! We can't wait to come back to try all the different pizzas!  Have not had pizza this good in a long time!

detailedReviews.author: Angelica Hart
detailedReviews.text:
Pizza is delicious, reminds me of NY üòú
Excellent service and clean place.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.3/5 rating from 100 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers consistently praise the authentic East Coast and Brooklyn-style pizza, noting its unique flavor and quality compared to other local options. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The Chicken Parm Pizza is highlighted as a standout item, with customers making special trips just to enjoy it. - social media marketing can showcase this strength
The service is frequently described as prompt and friendly, enhancing the overall dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Inconsistent quality of food, particularly with burnt or undercooked items - review management can address this concern
Long wait times and perceived slow service - Boostly marketing services can improve this
Lack of atmosphere and ambiance awareness - social media marketing can improve this area

positive.author: Mark Simons
positive.text: The Pizza is amazing, different from almost everywhere I've had around here, so good. I can't stop thinking about it.

positive.author: Bryan M
positive.text: Good ny style pizza. Tiny spicy pepperoni's. Great little gem in springville if you're craving pizza and don't want the large pizza chain bland pizza

positive.author: Brian Florang
positive.text: We had the lunch special. The pizza and service were very good. Enjoyed the authentic thin crust.

neutral.author: Deshavoo M
neutral.text: Pizza is great. Garlic knots were stale though and burnt‚òπÔ∏è

neutral.author: Liz Thibault
neutral.text: The pizza does remind me of NY style.  I appreciated the sauce, it had the taste of San Marzano tomatoes. The crust was also very good and has a think and floppy consistency. It was not too greasy, but I would have loved it to be just slightly more well-done, or to have been asked if I would like it baked to well-done. Wish the service was me streamlined.  Took the employee quite a while to pause what they were doing in the corner to acknowledge us.

neutral.author: aaron mangini
neutral.text: I wanted the traditional crispy crust that is associated with a good NY style pie, but the crust here was floppy and I even asked for them to baked it for a little longer to make sure I got a crispy crust. Which it was not. The young ladies behind the bar were great. The good thing is that a slice of pizza is inexpensive at only 3.50. maybe it was just the slice that I got, but Iight try it again due to the prices

negative.author: Hanna Nez
negative.text: Garlic knots were really hard and burned. I was looking forward to trying this place but don‚Äôt know if I‚Äôll go back.

negative.author: Taylor Safford
negative.text: We have ordered pizza from them before and it was great. This time they didn't put any sauce on it, burnt the bottom and it was like eating a flavorless piece of burnt bread. Disappointed!

negative.author: Yorq Ligma
negative.text:
It‚Äôs pizza, and it‚Äôs thin like a ny slice. But I found the sauce way too sweet. The crust was fine. Good hold with no flop. But the sauce ruined it.

Service was mid, slices took a little long. But I assume 2 slices, max 5 mins not 10. Everyone seemed bored. But that might just be the area or city service workers. At 7.25 min wage, I might be the same

Atmosphere was fine, lunch time, so it had some foot traffic. But some music would help

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
